title: Consider the purpose of the worksheet
text: Think about what the worksheet is trying to convey. Is it about a specific time period, a particular department, or a general collection of data?

title: Identify the audience
text: Who will be reading this worksheet? Is it for internal use, for a specific team, or for a broader audience?

title: Evaluate the clarity of the title
text: A good title should be clear and concise. It should give the reader an immediate understanding of the worksheet's content.

title: Select the most appropriate title
text: Based on the considerations of purpose, audience, and clarity, choose the best title from the options provided.
choices: Financial Team Collection of Data Updated With Permission From Corporate Department
